stimulusHtml: ​In the xy{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}-plane, the terminal ray of an angle in standard position intersects the unit circle at point P{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}. Which of the following is true about the cosine of the angle, as the angle measure increases from 0{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} to π{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} ?
choicesHtml: ​The cosine of the angle decreases then increases, because the horizontal displacement of P{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} from the y{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}-axis decreases, then increases over the interval.
​​The cosine of the angle decreases, because the horizontal displacement of P{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} from the y{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}-axis decreases over the entire interval.

​​The cosine of the angle increases, then decreases, because the vertical displacement of P{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} from the x{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}-axis increases, then decreases over the interval.
​​​The cosine of the angle decreases, because the vertical displacement of P{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} from the x{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}-axis decreases over the entire interval.
